page.title: 18Metal Box PLC Carlisle (ii)
page.content: The{James Street}studio comprises 3 artists, 3 photographic retouchers, and 2 camera operators who also do design work (5 litre cans & 20/25 litre drums) for MB Mansfield and Liv- erpool. Flat artwork must take account of the lines along which the tin will be stamped and folded. A negative for{ {each colour}is produced by photograph- ing the artwork through a fine screen of dots. Each negative is transferred to a sensitive metal plate which, mounted on the roller of the printing machine, prints{one colour}onto the plain tin sheets. These are dried in ovens and overprinted with the next colour until the design is complete. The{varnished}sheets are cut into strips for stamping out lids and fold- ing bodies. The production machines can be retooled to make all sizes and shapes of tins. {Continued on p.19>> }
